caption: Management poorly handled reservation we paid for balcony seating and failed to receive it.

This restaurant is the perfect birthday restaurant! Great service, great food, great atmosphere! I even had a really sweet “happy birthday” card waiting for me at my table when I arrived. I will be back very soon! Would recommend the sugar spice tequila drink and the roasted lamb starter.
We had an igloo at the terrace for bruch and the experience was amazing. The food options for igloo are limited but the food was delicious. Not to forget the amazing view of the wharf.
The view here was AMAZING. Overlooking the monument, capitol, and the Potomac, I don't think you can get a better view of the waterfront in DC. Food and services was exceptional too.

I really enjoyed my whole experience until the very end. My Bill came and I noticed that the bottle of wine I ordered had an additional charge of $10 added.  Of course I’m going to look at the itemized receipt before paying.  When I brought this to my waiters attention- he quickly went and fixed the price with no questions asked.  Afterwards, I am still left with an extremely sour feeling - how dare you try to cheat people out of money when the prices are already laughably high.  Please check your itemized checks when paying at this place.
My experience was very nice. However  it was a bit pricey. The drinks were $25 and the food was $95 per couple for the igloo experience. Date night cost a little over $400.

The restaurant service is great, but the issue is when you try to make a reservation for over 7 people they tell you to send an email & no one cares to reply. I sent 4 email & 2 phone calls but no reply. Management should look in to this. You shouldn't loose business because you are not returning reservation Emails. specially for first time visitors it gives a wrong message. first impression starts there.do I make sense?
Best food and VERY qualified service. Recommend for special occasions!

La Vie was amazing! We had an outside pod on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. The service was 5 star. We had the Caesar salad, steak and eggs and potatoes hash along with the La Vie AF drink. The food and beverage was delicious. I can't wait to go back!
Beautiful place, the food was awesome and service was fast. The only problem was the servers kept coming to take our drinks off the table at 10pm stating it was DC law.
Food delicious, ambiance amazing! I recommend 100%. Come prepared to spend money because it is pricey.

La Vie is a restaurant that emits high class and great food but I was not a fan. The food was good but the cost surely does not match the quality (especially for the truffle fries). I visited La Vie with a birthday party of 6 people so I got a chance to try different foods they had (Steak & Fries, Fennel Sausage Ragu, Lamb, etc). Their food was good, just that, good. One thing that put a salty taste in my month (no pun intended) was when they served the cake my family purchased elsewhere. We all thought that the cake tasted a bit off but it wasn't till we got home that we realized that they added salt to each piece of the cake that they served us. This was probably the most disrespectful thing that has happened to me and a party.
very happy with the experience , food was good and safety during covid was amazing
Awesome service.....Awesome time Angel waaaaaaaaaasssss THE BEST! DEF recommend the place for sure!
Nice place
Omg this is the best steak I have ever had. You will definitely not be disappointed.
Great customer service and great food
Great spot.....l love the igloo concept!!!!  Beautiful.... fabulous sunset.

Amazing, amazing wedding at La Vie! Our clients booked La Vie as their reception venue for their wedding! As a wedding planner, we work with many venues throughout the DMV but La Vie has to be the best. La Vie and its staff were exceptional! Cindy and her staff are so helpful and really made our couple feel amazing! Everything was amazing from the apps to the entrees as well as the responsiveness of the staff if something wasn't working! The oppurtunity for pictures at La Vie is out of this world with stunning views of the monuments and the Potomac River!
Great place for a date. Chic and nice interior, great service, excellent food and drinks.
Despite the terribly slow service, we had a great time and the brunch food was excellent (which helped significantly). Would visit again for sure with a different server than Peter.
Excellent atmosphere and the food was great

Horrible Igloo experience. I came to La Vie to celebrate a friend’s birthday and some of our appetizers did not arrive and then some of our entrees did not arrive. After realizing our food would take longer, because the kitchen messed up, we were kicked out of our igloo and sent inside so another party could take our place. The manager was more worried about the new customer getting seated than our experience being ruined. I would not recommend the igloo experience at all.

Visiting with my husband and another couple. The food was well-prepared, and the drinks were okay, but the service for the Igloos was terrible. Some of my order was even forgotten and because we were being rushed out I had to take it in a to-go box. We felt incredibly rushed throughout our entire experience, from the time we sat to when four waiters came into our igloo taking food away that wasn’t finished. For the price paid, terrible service as such doesn’t even morally make any sense. I doubt we will be revisiting this place. I advise they establish a better way to manage the “igloo experience” because my experience sucked.

La Vie is so beautiful!! The decor is absolutely stunning!! We loved the gorgeous outdoor igloos so perfect to cozy up with loved ones under the stars!! I celebrated my 30th birthday and we had the best night ever!! Thank you to Naeem and his amazing staff for making it happen!!
It is a VIBE! Food is superb and the customer service is exceptional! The food is pricey but worth every penny.

Decided to enjoy igloo with my co workers to celebrate a company milestone. Food was delicious and Overall atmosphere is great. However, the service was rushed, particularly in the Igloos. They charge a sanitizing fee and barely sanitize after guests leave. I witnessed their "sanitization routine" after an igloo next to mine feed up. The employee literally went in there with a a device and stayed for 15 seconds. It was rushed. Our waiter kept forgetting and mixing up our order. That annoyed my co worker so much that he went to the bar himself and grabbed his drink.

IGLOO REVIEW ONLY.  My gfs and I came here Saturday night for the "dinner in the igloo" experience--the igloo is located outside on their penthouse level but they are individually heated.  The igloos are well-lit and pretty--the décor and furniture inside are very chic!  Definitely picture-worthy here.  They also provide a Bluetooth speaker so that you can connect to your phone to play music!  There is a rental fee, but there was a special at the time I reserved the igloos so the rental fee was waived--however, I was required to make a $100 deposit that would be applied to the food & beverage minimum.  I had some questions regarding the booking and information that was posted online that seemed confusing--it was so hard to reach anyone at the restaurant--I called multiple evenings in a row and no one would pick up the phone calls--pretty frustrating.  I also emailed the restaurant and no one got back to me.  Food: There is a special Igloo Dinner Menu to order from.  Everything was amazing!  Our top favorites (and highly recommend) were the Roasted Lamb, Maryland Blue Crab Tartine, and the 18 oz. Bone-In Dry Age Ribeye.  For dessert, the Tiramisu was delicious!  Drinks are pricey here--their Specialty Cocktails were $25 each, and a basic cocktail like gin & club soda was $19.  Overall, the ambiance, service and food was great!
Everything here was perfect from the food to the service. It was a great place to celebrate a birthday and a beautiful location right on the dc waterfront! Definitely will be back in the summer!

I attended this restaurant on Christmas night. My date and I were looking forward to doing something relaxing and different. We reserved the IGLOO on the roof.  We did not expect the experience to be what it was. I'd been told by friends who enjoyed the Igloos in other locations that they were nice and warm. Not at La Vie, unfortunately this was a horrible experience.   It was very cold inside of the Igloo and not at all comfortable or relaxing.  I even commented that they needed better heaters. It was a waste of money because its not cheap and it was just the 2 of us.  I feel awful for recommending  La Vie. I told my other friends to pick a different place for an Igloo experience. No fun in being cold.
The lamb is delicious! Check this place out. Great date spot.
The 4 stars are for the beautiful atmosphere and the friendly staff, the food was pricey, which would not have been a problem if it was at least really good. The food was maybe 3 stars

La Vie a absolutely stunning restaurant. I am fairly new to the D.M.V. region.  Being active duty military and serving overseas for the past 5 years during the holidays, I was able to secure a reservation with  La Vie for Christmas and was greeted with overwhelming kindness.  When we arrived at the restaurant, the team at La Vie provided nothing short of exceptional service to my son and I.  Our food and my drinks were amazing and the view from the rooftop is absolutely breathtaking. My waitress was amazing and the kind gesture from the staff showed their commitment to excellence and gratitude towards our armed services. They are fully dedicated and thankful for their customers and I could not be more thankful for them!  I would recommend La Vie to anyone.
Great food! Very nice view.
It was great we really enjoyed our time there
Atmosphere is really cool, i am sure it was awesome be4 Covid. Yet still gr8 quality and service
Definitely want to visit again

While LaVie was I place I enjoyed, last Saturday I visited and was in complete disbelief. We booked a reservation, upon arrival we were told that we had to wait, we had to stand in their crowded waiting area with NO seating option. They were extremely busy and there was NO Social Distancing in place. When we were finally allowed upstairs, we had to wait again, standing again and NO Social Distancing, again.  At the entrance we had to make our way to the reception, it was crowded with people waiting and people from a wedding engaging in conversations. It was like we were at a club. I sent an email to management but no one responded in acknowledgment. That says a lot.

FOOD WAS DISGUSTING . I don’t recommend this place to nobody . Everything had a tangy taste and not a pleasant tangy taste at all . Got 5 cocktail shrimp over a big bowl of ICE ... like where is the rest of the shrimp ? I was so disappointed. It wasn’t even worth the money or time .
It was beautiful; decor, ambience, and location was great! Saw the beautiful sunset, which added to the overall ambience. I would definitely visit again!
I went for my birthday dinner it was amazing
The food is amazing! The best atmosphere in DC. The staff is great as well we will be back! Highly recommend this place! Thank you for the hospitality!

Updated to include date of visit. I had a reservation for 2 yesterday (October 25, 2020) for 2:00 pm. Unfortunately, due to the serve rainstorm which as a result caused horrific traffic; I arrived at LA Vie at 2:12 pm checked in and was asked to take my temperature, which I did. Once that was completed the receptionist told me that my table (that should have already been ready at 2:00 pm) was not available and that I would need to have a seat in the lobby and wait for it. I decided to use the restroom instead as I wait for the table. Around 2:16 pm I returned to the lobby. At this point the second half to my party (party of 2) arrived and had already checked in. I approached the reception area and asked for an update on the table. I was then told by the receptionist that because I JUST arrived (keep in mind I arrived 4 minutes ago and my friend arrived at 2:15 pm) and because there are no available tables to seat my friend and I , we would have to wait an hour after being told less than five minutes ago that a table was being prepared for us. The attitudes of the two receptionist was EXTREMELY DSIGUSTING and very unprofessional. Having been lied on by them both, saying that I arrived more than 20 minutes late (which is false, I arrived at 2:12 pm) and then telling me I would have to wait an hour for an available table after telling me that one would be available “shortly” was very disappointing considering that I drove more than 30 minutes in the rain. While disputing our case with the receptionist, I received a notification via email that my reservation at La Vie has been canceled.  One thing to note: La Vie Brunch ends at 3:30pm, however when we arrived the manager said the kitchen actually stops serving food at 2:45 pm. Personally, I believe this should have been clearly stated on the La Vie website because had I seen that I definitely would not have made a reservation for 2:00pm.  La Vie in DC= Awful customer service. I and my friends and family will not be visiting this establishment ever again. I hope this review gives you some insight on whether to patronize this establishment.

Love the ambiance, decor and service. Food is great. Second time going since covid restrictions. Reservation process was easy, even on day of...parking great. Dod not have pink cotton candy dessert I specifically ordered in Oct. to celebrate a friend for beating breast cancer bit our server was bomb so!
We had an incredible brunch here. The environment is amazing, staff Is fantastic (Miguel was over the top and so service oriented). Such a great experience!
Phenomenal food! Phenomenal staff! It's my new favorite restaurant.

Beautiful ambiance, delicious food and excellent service. Our waiter Ali was amazing. He helped make my friend’s birthday a day to remember. With everything going on, it was nice to get out and enjoy a great meal with friends at La Vie.

The hosting service was horrible.  They were unaccommodating to say the very least.   I arrived and had to wait to be seated however, while waiting to be seated, others walked in and were seated prior to my party.  Beautiful ambience and scenery but horrible service. Unfortunately, I will not be back.
The restaurant itself is gorgeous and the views of the wharf are amazing. Food is delicious every time I go and service is always impeccable.
Great food! Service from staff is a little slow.

I would say if you love creative presentation, quality and beautiful atmosphere, this is the place to go. Its beautifully decorated, the out door patio overlooks the water and it is definitely an Instagram worthy date night spot. Their gnocchi is so soft and pillowy, seafood is fresh and well prepared and the dessert was so cute and creative! All in all, a great experience:) a bit expensive...a little over 200 for my boyfriend and I but we splurged a bit and enjoyed everything about this place :)

I’ve had my eye on this restaurant for a very long time. I’ve read reviews and this place lives up to its hype. The food was magnificent, deliciously flavored. The view was breathtaking, a sight worth traveling for. The only down side was the noise but hey, it was a Saturday night so I can’t complain too much. Our waiter was extremely polite and attentive. The experience was everything and more, a must must visit.

For a for profit business, these people sure do not care about making money. It would be easier to get in touch with Putin than the event coordinator at La Vie. Seems like a waste of a salary to me. A friend of mine has been waiting to hear back from them regarding an event this month, and no one has bothered to return any messages. WHERE IS THE CUSTOMER SERVICE AND ACCOUNTABILITY? He has visited the restaurant numerous times to speak to someone and no one seems to have any answers as to how to get in touch with the Event Coordinator. As you may have read from past reviews, there are serious customer service issues at this place. The manager and staff have been unhelpful. Who exactly is running this place?! As a former event manager, I simply cannot understand the lack in communication with potential clients. It’s simply disrespectful of people’s time and energy. There are so many other venues on the wharf that will gladly communicate and accommodate their patrons and clients without the stress and headache. If I were you, I’d steer clear of this place for any special occasions. Where the is smoke, there is fire. Choose wisely.

Don’t waste your time unless you got money to waste or only want drinks. Salad was small, chicken unflavored, lamb tasted musty and yes i said musty because it tasted like how an armpit would smell, grape leaves tasted like cold meat
The stake frite was perfect. Great service and ambiance.
Love this place! $45 brunch on the weekend.
The ambiance was great. The drinks were unique and good. The food was not as I expected it to be thou, except for the appetizers...
Excellent service
Instagram restaurant. Food is pricey but worth the price. You should come dressed well. Servers are great.
Love the food and ambiance.

Our group was looking forward to this place from seeing all the rave about food. We made reservation @ 2. Driving in the rain, looking forward to the food we came at 215. I tried to call at 154 to notify we were being late but hold time was too long. Finally we come up and receptionist downstairs tells "better hurry up because they are doing last call at 245pm". Check in with the hostess, she says the same thing then states your reservation was cancelled and she has to speak to manager (btw no notification of any cancelation via email). She says to have a seat to wait for the table..Finally we get to the table, the waitress was amazing and she is the only one that deserves any stars for this place! Too many people came up to the table to take orders that never made to the kitchen. My friend who came later asked for a vegetarian menu prior to 245 but somehow the order never was fulfilled then the chef refused to honor it..Security can use people skills and stop intimidating your guests who pay to be there. Being approached in such unprofessional manner to "round up" or "leave" is despicable for any place. First of all, decor dissapointing, flowers are not even real on the table..all plastic! when anyone makes a reservation they should be told right away about 245 kitchen closing.  Pros: food, the views, tapas style  Cons: plastic flowers, disorganized, rude security, portions (if table is for 5 people, don't bring 2 pieces of tartines)  Overall the vibe left from this places brunch was dissapointment! We aren't sure if we would be back for brunch, maybe dinner experience is much different and the reason for the good reviews...  Note to anyone placing reservation at 2, they will close all orders at 245. No valet parking here either.

The food was good and the place is beautiful, but the customer service at the front desk was poor! La Vie is not the best place for an special occasion. Considering the price, there are much better “upscale” restaurants in DC area one can try.

The restaurant is very nice, my girls and I had a great time and the food was really good just expensive for the portions they give. The drinks where really good too and the atmosphere was such a vibe. It’s a nice aesthetic for taken pictures too. Loved the experience.
Good selection for brunch, served tapas style. Dishes were inventive and cooked well. View and ambiance give bougie brunch vibes...so here for it!

La Vie was amazing!!!! The Food was great very filling cooked perfectly, the Ambiance was amazing, the drinks were amazing, the service was amazing our waiter was great, I’ll definitely be back! The restaurant was a bit loud but it’s a popular place and it was good amount of folks there sat night. They are doing things to ensure their patrons are safe like taking temperatures with a thermal camera and spacing out the seating, the outdoor seating area was spectacular I’ll be sitting there next time.

I came here for my birthday dinner and I must say I throughly enjoyed my time. The food was absolutely delicious and well portioned. Our waiter/bartender was very attentive and provided excellent service. The best meal of the night were the lamb chops, they were very juicy and spiced perfectly.  The space has been redesigned to adhere to COVID guidelines and there is a temperature check upon arrival. My party and I felt very safe. The only thing I would say we didn’t like was that it was a bit noisy so it was hard to talk to each other at the table.  Overall, I would most definitely come back here and I would definitely recommend this restaurant. The drinks were delicious and strong.
Great food and attentive service, not to mention the beautiful view of the wharf. The grilled octopus and tuna tartare were our favorites.
The food was excellent, delicious and filling. Will eat here again in the future.
Amazing Brunch! They do a tapas style brunch now. Because of covid.
Great vibe, great crowd. The food and its presentation were really great also.  The inside of this establishment is very elegant and inviting.

Horrible customer service experience with the front desk. Gave my family and horrible attitude for us before seating us. Immediately left. Very sad, won’t go again. A shame this kind of service is present given the legal scrutiny the restaurant is already under.

It was okay for the simple fact that the service was okay. Had to wait for a server to show up to our table. There was a wait for the drinks. We had to keep asking for the drinks over and over. The server was disappearing and we had to ask other employees to look for him. The excuse for the delay was that they were backed up. Why don't have enough employees on the shift when you know that weekends are busy.  Food critiques: Drink I first wanted to try the  Green Juice Gimlet but they had run out of the fresh cucumber juice hence I couldn't have it. I then decided to get the Strawberry Letter 4.6 and guess what it was the same thing; not available. I just went for a glass of citron pressé because I told myself that they will not run out of lemons to make a lemonade. It was a regular lemonade with no flavor. It says to be house-made lavender lemonade but it was very bland.  Food: The beet Salad was appealing and delectable. It was my favorite. The steak Frites was palatable.  Desert: The Cotton-Candy Baked Alaska perfectly honeyed. I would recommend it to people that want a dessert that is not too sweet.
Brunch tapas style. Food was about $40 per person and unlimited mimosas was $23 person. I don’t think we ate $40 worth of food but we definitely got our monies worth with the drinks.
Great atmosphere! Enjoyed the food and service. I would visit again.
The view was breath-taking, service top notch and the good exquisite.
The receptionist made us wait for 40 minutes at first and then communicated that they don't have space anymore. Absolute waste of time !
Wonderful staff
The atmosphere was amazing and cozy! Food was excellent. I will definitely come back again!!!
Great atmosphere! Great food! Great service! Peter is the best!!!
The lamb chops were delicious, drinks were tasty, dessert was spectacular.

Loved the experience on their patio. Real beautiful. Ordered the Seafood Tagliatella and it was delicious even though it was more zesty than I like. Sometimes, I feel as though, their front hostest don't like going above and beyond for certain people. You have to ask for something twice or thrice before they verify is okay. Remove the experience with them, the place and experience is a must have.

Amazing food, ambiance and service. Everything about this place screams elegance and class. Our waiter Leo G was just the best. We were a large loud group and he was the most professional and patient. Our host who seated us can't remember his name ( Ann?)  was just a breath of fresh air so funny and personable. We had an amazing time and coming back soon. p.s this drink is a must try. You can eat the flower too!!

This review isn’t for poor restaurant service, but for poor treatment. My fiancé and I, along with my mother, drove from Virginia to DC in rush hour traffic for a 5:30 appointment we’d made with Cindy, the event coordinator for La Vie, regarding a tour of the restaurant and it’s availability for a wedding venue in October. After some brief email correspondence, the only apparent point of contact in reaching anyone for information regarding events and booking, we’d made an appointment and made it on time, despite traffic.  Instead of being greeted by Cindy, we were greeted by a young guy who seemed surprised at our mention of an appointment, and was clearly not expecting us. After several minutes of waiting and texting Cindy, he made things clear that she would not be joining, and would instead give us a tour of the restaurant himself. While he was friendly and certainly trying his best, he may not be best suited for running point on showcasing all La Vie has to offer.  The restaurant boasts several breath taking spaces, and even more beautiful views of Washington, most of the spaces were unavailable for booking, not due to availability, but because the restaurant keeps these spaces open only for business during hours of operation. This left us with only 2 spaces, which was a penthouse on the floor above the main restaurant, a small space currently being renovated or remodeled best suited for night time clubbing, and the two spaces within the restaurant proper, a green room with a king bar and large green booths or a space in the back which really didn’t have a theme of any kind.  Countless pre-booked wedding venues have been cancelled this year due to the pandemic. So when restaurants become viable options for a small wedding, you would expect minimum effort of professionalism and courtesy. I’m sorry to say this wasn’t the case.  La Vie is a great night club and restaurant in DC. Just don’t have your wedding or reception here.
I loved the scenery, and the food was incredible! I tried the burger and the pasta and just wow
Peter is amazing!!!!!!!!! First time visiting La Vie and definitely will be returning again ❤️❤️❤️

Came here with some friends for a birthday brunch and we had a blast. We all had the bottomless brunch with drinks included. Some of our brunch food favorites include the smoked salmon tartine, avocado tartine, steak tartare, duck carbonara, salmon souvlaki, short rib hash, and the truffle fries. The tartines are a must try. The pastas were delicious as well. If you love fries definitely order the truffle fries. The truffle was so rich we had to order it twice. I noticed the proteins including the short rib, meatballs and steak were very tender and seasoned well. Views and ambience here are great. If you want a soft pink couch, views of the Potomac river or the long tunnel full of green decor this is your spot.  Service here was amazing! Our drinks and plates were constantly getting refilled/switched out. Food came out quickly and Covid mask rules were strictly enforced. The only reason why I'm giving this place a star off is because of the price. Brunch was around $70 including drinks, but once you add on the taxes, gratuity and 4% merchant processing fee each persons tab came out close to $100. We made sure to get our moneys worth, but it maybe best to wait till post Covid to dine here.

This place is phenomenal! Miami vibe in D.C. ...wow!!! From the decor,  to the drinks and food I can't even put it into complete sentences. Definitely going back and taking all my people there! The staff is by far some of the friendliest and most skilled in DC hands down. Very attentive and cool to chat it up with.
Amazin food an drinks
Great restaurant! Delicious food and awesome service! I recommend! Thanks La Vie!
Friendly service

Server was attentive, thorough, funny and patient. Food was incredible. The mixed drinks are worth every penny. The server surprised us with cake and libations for our c Special occasions we were celebrating.
Great view and amazing brunch options. Highly recommend!

The atmosphere was awesome beautiful place however the food was not Hot at all.... it’s expensive be prepared to spend well over 100 dollars! The waitress brought out the wrong drink several times... ! The Cotton Candy Cake was amazing

We have eaten here on many occasions.  The food has been terrific each time.  Aside from one waiter who seemed like they were having a bad day, we have had excellent service.   We will continue to dine here plus the views are awesome.

Horrible service the waiter barely came back to the table to check on the party. We were done eating by the time one of my friends food came. Although the gratuity is included we should’ve received the same level of customer service. The food was amazing and so was the ambience.
Great food and Great View. Fun for a night.

First, we didn't make reservations yet they still accommodated us and gave us a table. Very friendly service. The food was amazing and the drinks were divine. Views were fantastic! A lovely dinner experience!

The service was ok, and so was the food. When we entered the establishment we had to wait for about 10-15 minutes for our waitress. Not to mention after paying 800. 00 for a tab, we were told our parking would be validated. Of course when we went to leave the parking garage we still had to pay an additional $28.00. I called the restaurant I spoke with someone by the name of Kaitlin, which she over spoke me, and didn’t even care to hear what I was saying. Which is the staff should advise that the validation is only $10.00. Of course unbeknownst to us at the time. I asked her to speak to a manager. I was then greeted by someone who informed me she was not a manager but was NOT willing to provide me her name. She advised me the restaurant was busy and a manager was not available could she take a message. I informed the unknown representative that it was not ok and that I needed to speak with a manager. After asking for her name several times she indicated that she was NOT willing to provide the name. I have been on hold for 30minutes. I feel like she’s only keeping me on hold so that i can hang up. During the pandemic you just want to engage in any thing close to normal activities. If this is normal, I’m afraid I WILL NOT BE ENGAGING in any activities that this establishment has. Of course I will let my friend and family know. Who are all patrons. I will never visit the establishment again and I advise others to do the same. After begin on hold for 35 minutes I was hung up on. Of course I called back and was advised that all the managers were busy. If this is an upscale dining experience I find that hard to believe with the custom service I received. I spoke with the manager Mike, he was understanding and compassionate to the problem.
username: Keemah's World Yall just livin in it

caption: This place is absolutely gorgeous. Definitely for people who appreciate ambience and will dress the part (ex. Not wearing sneakers). I had the pork tagliatelle and it was perfectly portions and delicious. Nice bottle of dom perigon and a complimentary glass after we finished the bottle from our waiter. He was professional, attentive, and very knowledgeable of the menu and champagne pairings. P.s. didn’t stay, but looks like the bar scene was lively!
Summer ending drinks on deck!

(Translated by Google) Very elegant, as if to impress someone. However, the service at the reception is not good, especially if there are groups larger than 4 people, you must wait for all the guests in your reservation to arrive, to be able to sit at the table and you must wait standing (since they do not offer you no chair or water while you wait).  (Original) Muy elegante, como para impresionar a alguien. Sin embargo, la atención en la recepción no es buena, especialmente si van grupos mayores a 4 personas, debes esperar que lleguen todos los invitados en tu reserva, para poder sentarte en la mesa y debes esperar de pie (toda vez que no te ofrecen ni silla ni agua mientras esperas).
Excellent ambiance and our waiter, Ali, went over and beyond.

I had a reservation for my birthday and thought that it would be a pleasant experience but I wasn’t satisfied.  First, we bring a store brought cake and give to them to hold. We sit down and a lady (management I’m guessing) comes to the table with a very discourteous tone and proceeds to tell us that we will be charged a “cake holding fee” of $40. More than we even spent on the cake! And that additional fee should have been made clear before the cake was in their possession.  We had to track our waiter down the whole night because he was busy serving so many tables. All of our food came at room temperature like it had been sitting for awhile. But they didn’t forget to include that 20% gratuity at the end that I felt wasn’t deserved. We also found corn and hair in our margaritas smh.  Oh! And they also charged an extra sanitation fee in which they used alcohol wipes to wipe the table down and placed our silverware on the bare table which I felt was disgusting.  Will not be returning.. expected high class service and got less than

Excellent  only things that was a little Annoying was the built-in 23% gratuity I still think gratuity should be based on customer service quality of food and particularly the cleanliness and social distancing that is even possible and reasonable at a dine out setting food absolutely to die for
Amazing  Place

Food was delicious and fast to come out, they are actively practicing social distancing precautions. Service was friendly and the view was beautiful! Definitely a good place to take someone special for a nice occasion. We ordered 3 'to share' items which was the perfect amount for two people- highly recommend the French mussel pot, mediterranean dip trio and the lamb

Absolutely love this place! not just the environment but also the service, they really know how to make you feel special and welcomed. The sugar spice tequila cocktail is a MUST try, it's so good and every ingredient blends in so immaculately. Literally from the appetizers all the way to dessert, everything went amazing. This was my second time coming and everything went just as great! Will absolutely be coming back.
They just don't care about people. Simple"

We went for dinner during a Friday night happy hour and were told, after sitting down, that happy hour prices were only at the bar. So, we walked up to the bar and took a few glasses of wine back to our table with the blessing of the bartender and manager. 15 minutes later, our waiter returned and gave a lecture about how he knew we went to the bar but would do us the favor of serving us anyway. The food we ordered tasted great and we loved the view of the sunset out the window. Aside from our waiter, the rest of the staff were prompt and polite.

This was my first time at La Vie. We made reservations for 6pm on a Thursday night before a show next door at The Anthem. Traffic was horrendous, so we called to push it to 6:15, and they were very accommodating.  Like other businesses at the DC Wharf, if arriving by car your only parking option is the underground garage. Beware, it’s pricey. I think it was about $30 for the 4 hours we were there, between dinner and show.  We parked near the stairs with the pretty waterfall wall and La Vie was right there on street level. It’s on the second floor, so the outdoor hostess directed us to the elevator and instructed us to select floor 4.6. That is not a typo. (I found it very Harry Potter-esque)  La Vie can boast that there are some gorgeous views from their dining room and bar area. You can see the whole marina, promenade, fancy boats and yachts and a beautiful sunset if you are there at dinner hour. At night, it’s equally stunning. Even the docks have little lights embedded in the boards!  We were seated right away along the windows. Most people were there after work in their work attire, and some were dressed up for special occasion. My friend and I were dressy casual in slacks because of the show we were seeing afterward, but we didn’t feel too out of place. It is a gorgeous dining room, with that spectacular view, so I could see how this would be a great date night or special occasion venue.  Although our waiter was a bit detained, the manager came over and helped us get started with some cocktails. I had Le Paloma, which he warned had a smoky flavor from the mezcal (and he wasn’t lying). I didn’t mind the smoke, but didn’t find the drink well-balanced against the sweet juices. My friend had the Crazy Pineapple, which was far better balanced and tasty (if you don’t mind sweet). I ordered one myself since Le Paloma didn’t suit me, but sadly they didn’t take my first drink off the check despite it remaining 3/4 full on the table.  There is no bread basket or noshing type food while you wait for your meal, so if you arrive starving you better order an appetizer. Just a word to the wise.  We ordered the beet salad to share as an appetizer, and it was delicious. Multi-color beets, a yogurt based dressing drizzled over it, walnuts, and salad greens. And a great portion for two people as an appetizer. Recommend.  My friend ordered the pork ragu, which she said was very good. She ordered a side of roasted cauliflower au gratin, which I sampled. It was good, and had some mint leaves sprinkled on top for a unique flavor. It’s a healthy portion for more than one person, so I would recommend sharing the side.  I had the steak and truffle frites with a bearnaise sauce. It almost looked like a puttanesca sauce with its orangey color, moreso than a traditional yellow bearnaise, but it had the classic tarragon flavor to it.  Sadly we had to run to our show so we skipped the coffee/dessert course (very unlike us!). Waiter was prompt with the check, and we made it to our show by 7:40 after our 6:15 seating. Not bad, timing wise.  Last tip: if you have leftovers to take home, be sure you put them in your car before going to The Anthem. My friend thought it would be ok since it was wrapped and placed in a nice handled paper bag, and we had actual seats for the show, but they told her she either had to coat check it ($5 fee), or toss it, as they don’t allow outside food. So be sure to put it in your car before you arrive at the theater!

The views are amazing. There are three different areas you can hang out for happy hour, outside, overlooking the waterfront, inside at the glassy-glossy bar, and inside the greenery bar room. (I made up these room titles based on my own take) For happy hour, I highly recommend. And for brunch, I've had a great experience. Dinner is good, expensive, but not amazing. If you have heard meh reviews about this restaurant, I would give it a second chance. It's really quite good. If nothing else, go for a drink and the ambiance.

Horrible service, great food! Upon arriving we were seated at a lovely table for two by the window with a beautiful view of the Wharf. 20 minutes later, no water and never greeted by any server. Eventually a random person from the staff brought water and took our order for an appetizer. He seemed confused and said that he would find our server. The appetizer was delivered by kitchen staff and this person took our entree order and he also seemed confused to learn that we had no server. Our entrees were delivered and after an hour of being there, still no server. No server ever greeted us, talked about the menu, took drink orders, or checked on us until about halfway through our meal when a random server seemed to take interest and we ordered lavendar lemonades (delicious). This server engaged in a few seconds of awkward conversation and eventually brought the check. Strange....but the food was delicious! Not sure if I will dine here again.  UPDATE: Response to the owner, It happened this past Saturday, July 27th. 4:30 reservation. Thanks!

The Joke is on You at La Vie.  I came in on a Saturday evening with a reservation, this place boasts a view but instead we were seated in another part of the restaurant with no windows and no view. I'm assuming this is the sports bar part.  That's ok, there is the food right? Hopefully that will make up for it. I look at the prices and I'm thinking ok these are fine dining prices, this will be delicious.  We start with the drinks and starting at $14 I order a Spritz Aperol -- 70% of this was ice. Ok, well i guess this is the Wharf but for a place named La Vie and at these prices I'd expect some garnishing or at least more of the drink I couldn't get at a local bar.  Moving on, we order appetizers and I ask to hold an order. Our server didn't hold it, it came out anyway. Ok, whatever onto the mains.  So I don't really write reviews often, but when I do it's because I'm disappointed AF and feel like a place is a rip off because it attempts to trick you into thinking it's something it is not.  La Vie is NOT fine dining.  I ordered the Steak Frites, the steak came out watery (likely defrosted) with NO flavor. I embarrassingly had to ask for more salt. I've never ordered a steak at any restaurant in DC and had to ask for salt. The fries had more flavor than the steak. I'll give them that they cooked it medium rare well, but bc of the temperature.i can tell that it was sous vide'd.  I don't finish the steak but tried a bite of the Lobster Squid Ink. The pasta is soggy. The Italian ancestors are rolling in their graves.  And the Duck Confit was a Frankenstein dish, just Google Duck Confit and compare it against my photo.  In summary, this place isn't fine dining, the chef unfortunately needs to question the work product. The staff is friendly and if you ask for the view ahead of time the ambience is great, but at these prices if you're here to eat, the joke is on you. Rip off.

I took my mom here to celebrate her 70th birthday and the staff was rude and inconsiderate.  I notified the restaurant of the occasion when I made the reservation and requested a table by the window.  I also called the day of the reservation to put in the request.  When we arrived, although there were open tables by the window, the host refused to seat us at one, saying they were for other parties.  We only had three people in our party -- not big at all -- and I was astonished by their refusal to seat us by a window after my efforts to advise them of our request and the special occasion.  I can't recommend a restaurant like that to anyone.  A 70th birthday only happens once and La Vie nearly ruined it for us.

While our first drink order came within a reasonable time, the second round took a lot longer to the point we had to ask if they were coming, only for me to received the wrong drink twice (I understand it was the bar and not the waitress). But our waitress also seemed awkward serving us, reaching across one of my friends to serve me and another friend from the opposite side of the table, then again trying to clear unnecessary item from one side of our table inside of walking around from the other side (our table was in the middle of the room and she had access from all sides). If La Vie was able to have a more polished wait staff then I would have given them 5 stars.

Good view, inconsistent food, and indifferent service.  The decor is nice, and the views are great, but as with many restaurants it mistakes overwhelming noise for atmosphere.  The food was ok, but several dishes suffered from overseasoning/saucing, rendering the primary flavors moot.  The duck and the steak tartare were especially affected.  Our waitress seemed at best uninterested, never checking on our meal or asking about the numerous empty cocktail glasses.   The check did appear immediately upon dessert being served, so I guess she was paying some attention.  A second cup of coffee would have been nice, though.  And, annoyingly, when ordering four appetizers for a table of four, three of them came with only 3 portions.  I get not being able to scale to a table of six, but this seemed especially stingy given the prices.  La Vie seems to be yet another Waterfront restaurant content to coast on it's location.

Gorgeous space with an upscale vibe but not a stuffy feeling. This restaurant is located on the Wharf which means great views as you're walking to it and even better views from the rooftop deck. The restaurant is beautiful.  Came here for a friend's birthday and was so excited to check it out! You have to take an elevator to get up to the restaurant.  We started with drinks and I ordered the rivera highball. This drink tasted pretty much like pink lemonade. I'm not sure there was much alcohol in it.  I ordered the salmon which was pretty standard. The salmon wasn't totally dry but it wasn't on par with other restaurants' salmon. My friends seemed to enjoy their other food, including the burger which was gigantic and very decadent! I was able to snag some of the fries and they were great.  We ordered the tiramisu for dessert and I was pretty underwhelmed.  The reason I'm giving this review three stars is for two reasons: 1) the food was okay but mainly because the service was all over the place. We had to wait like 10 minutes to get water in our glasses after the waiter came over to our table. Then another member of our party ordered her food a bit later than we did and she waited for at least 25 minutes for the food to come out. The waiter basically disappeared at this point and kept telling us the front part of the restaurant was slammed but I never saw him leave the kitchen area. At one point he and another waiter were socializing off to the side. So yeah. It seems like there are some kinks that need to be worked out here but I think there are lots of other options for dining on the Wharf these days.  Maybe it's a better spot for drinks and a view which seems like something this place would be nice for. It was far too expensive for the quality of dinner and service we received.

Deciding to be a hip/elegant/accessible restaurant/bar/lounge club is a pretty tall order, and a mission could easily go horribly wrong as they try to do do a bit of everything.  But La Vie actually manages to do it well.  How? Basically by doing everything right.  The service was great: really professional but totally unpretentious. Our waiter could talk in detail about every beer, wine & cocktail; and was happy to let us test multiple samples before making a decision.  The food was excellent; accessible, creative and done well. It's not the most gourmet I've ever had, but it's extremely dependable.  And the management were on the ball, checking to see how their diners were enjoying themselves, open to feedback, and welcoming.  La Vie could soooo easily be style over substance. But it's not. And the fact they deliver on substance means it's a completely solid bet for the range of experiences they're offering.

A must experience!

Went here for my 3 year wedding anniversary with my husband. I made a reservation on open table. I heard from a friend it got bad reviews and the plates were small but I'm glad I didnt listen to them! The atmosphere was great, and they even gave us 2 complimentary drinks when we got there because our table wasnt quite ready. We started off with the duck confit, then I had the pea risotto with crab and my husband had the pasta and clams. Side order of brussel sprouts. Everything tasted amazing! Had enough for left overs that that tasted even better the next day! Kind of pricey, around $115 total bill, but I dont suppose people are going here every night. Will be going back when my parents are in town !

Let me just start by the only positive things that La Vie has to offer are the chic modern industrial design and the view.  Upon arrival, my girlfriend and I were greeted by a very nice friendly host who showed us to our table. Our server came by fairly quickly and took our drink order. Our cocktail took about 20 minutes to show up even though neither the restaurant nor the bar seemed very busy. Halfway through the time we were waiting for our drinks, the server came and took our food order, he never asked if we had any questions about the menu or if we had any food allergies( granted not required, but a sophisticated touch). We ordered oysters, grilled octopus, and a lamb appetizer in philo to start followed up with the gilled branzino filet. Another 20 minutes later the warm appetizers showed at the same time as the oysters. I couldn’t comprehend how the raw food can be served at the same time as the hot one. At this point I’m still giving the place the benefit of the doubt, so we decided not to let the food get cold and start with the lamb pie, which was very good and flavorful, and the grilled octopus, which was nothing to rave about. Halfway through the warm apps, not having touched the oysters yet, our entree was brought to the table. I asked another waitress to grab our server’s attention, but she insisted that she can help with whatever we needed. I explained to her that we weren’t done with our appetizers yet, and that our entree shouldn’t have been brought to the table to get cold. She replied that the kitchen is closing soon, so they are pushing food out as fast as they can so they can leave, and she went to get a manager.   I was in complete awe of the explanation she tried to offer. The manager came to the table with a big attitude, and without addressing the issue, he proceeded to take the entree of the table and said he would hold it ( not have another one remade) until we’re finished. Who wants to eat food that sat to dry up under a heat lamp for 20 to 30 min? Next we moved on to the oysters, 3 of which sat In a murky pool of water. As I moved to dump the water out, it turned out to be very slimy and mucus like substance. If that’s not a sign of a bad oyster I don’t know what is. I immediately pointed that out to the server and asked him to bring our check. He cleared our plates and sent the manager over once again. The manager offered no apologies, and told me that the chef tried the oysters that we sent back, there was no problem with them he added. He said that we didn’t have a check since we didn’t have a good experience. I told him that I would gladly pay for what we consumed and leave at tip for the server since the bad experience was of no fault of his, but more the fault of an incompetent kitchen and an incompréhensive management. I can see why the Washington Post food critic gave them no stars.  I left a tip on table for the server, and will not be returning anytime soon. They also canceled my reservation  even though we were there, I guess they don’t want me to post this review on open table.

However, the restaurant is in a prime location with a nice view. I would recommend it more as a lounge for a drink with friends.

My husband and I went to this restaurant for a late night Valentine’s date. We are married with two small kids, so any time we can get out is special.  When we got there my husband let me out so I could check in for our reservation and he could park. Because the day and time, the restaurant was turning into a lounge (which we did not know) and there was a doorman checking ids. He was fine we me. However, when my husband (a 6’3 black man) came to the door the doorman was not letting him in. He told my husband the restaurant/kitchen was closed (which was a lie because we made a 10:30pm reservation on Open Table). He also told my husband that there was a dress code (which was a lie because there was a white man sitting near our table wearing a tee-shirt and I believe jeans). It wasnt until my husband told the doorman that my wife is upstairs and we made a 10:30pm reservation that he let him in. It was so late and we were so excited about being out without the kids that we decided to stay and not let that moment ruin our time. However, I woke up the next day upset about what happened.  Once we were inside the food and service were fine (which is why I gave this review 2 stars instead of 1) but who wants their crab risotto with a side of racial profiling? Do better La Vie!
